summary: A news article from New York Magazine exploring the business and personal ties between Jeffrey Epstein and his brother Mark Epstein, focusing on their interconnected real estate ventures and the use of Mark's properties to house Epstein's associates and alleged victims. It raises questions about the extent of Mark's knowledge and involvement.

keyFacts: Mark Epstein's real estate company, Ossa Properties, is linked to Jeffrey Epstein's company, J. Epstein & Co., through shared asset manager Jonathan Barrett.

Jeffrey Epstein allegedly housed friends, employees, associates, and alleged victims (including models from the MC2 agency) in apartments at 301 East 66th Street, a building majority-owned by his brother Mark.
Mark Epstein has publicly distanced himself from his brother's activities, calling business connections a "mistake" and claiming not to monitor who uses apartments in his building.
A 2010 sworn statement from a former MC2 employee alleged that models from the agency were victims of Epstein's underage sex-trafficking ring.
Associates of Jeffrey Epstein who rented apartments or ran businesses from Mark's building included his ex-girlfriend, his pilot, and his MC2 business partner Jean-Luc Brunel.
